newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Coca-Cola Enterprises EPS cut.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Coca-Cola Enterprises EPS cut.

text.p: -- PaineWebber cut its profit estimates for Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc's first quarter and full fiscal year in 1997.

-- The company said earlier it would take a $6 million charge, or $0.03 a share, related to a debt redemption. It also said noncash expenses related to some stock-based compensation plans were higher than expected.

-- Analyst Emanuel Goldman said in a research report the expenses caused him to trim Q1 EPS estimates by $0.11 to a loss of $0.34 a share. Full year 1997 earnings per share were cut by $0.15 to a profit of $0.90 a share. The estimates exclude the $0.03 a share charge related to the debt redemption.
-- The stock keeps its attractive rating.
-- The company had a pro forma loss of $0.31 a share in the first quarter of 1996 and a pro forma profit of $0.58 a share for the full year of 1996.
